alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Bullock; Montgomery; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:03PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Pike, southern Bullock, Montgomery and Barbour Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 303 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Montgomery to near Troy to near Richards Crossroads. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Troy, Eufaula, Union Springs, Brundidge, Clio, Goshen, Meadville, Pike Road, Clayton, Louisville, Banks, Blue Springs, Tyler Crossroads, Pickett, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Dublin, Woodcrest, Beans Crossroads and Snowdoun. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Birmingham.
